ratings.comment: I've had Monica for two semesters now, and she is absolutely my favorite professor so far. She really encourages class participation and conversation, and handled the transition to online classes really well this past spring. She really challenges you to push yourself to think deep about topics discussed in class, but it definitely pays off!
Monica is my favorite undergraduate professor. I was sad when her class ended for the semester.

Monica's classes are a ton of work but SO worth it because she tries to prepare you for your future. Take the time to get to know her and she can be your most useful resource. Just be ready to put in the work to earn your grade.

Monica did a great job presenting info that students need to succeed in internships after graudation. She really cares about he students and is very willing to help. She makes the guidelines for the first assingment intentionally ambiguous because she wants students to problem solve, but is open to questions and holds workshops to clarify.
Outstanding class.  A lot of writing but worth it in the end.

Monica is the best professor I have ever had! She is very nice and understands that students have lives outside of her class. The class work is reasonable and the exams are fair. If you study and do your work, you should get an "A"

This professor struggles communicating clear assignment guidelines. She often comes to class with the erroneous belief that her students are not prepared and lack the ability to succeed.  This misconception, in addition to whether or not she likes a student, has an effect on grades. She assigns too much work for a student who has other classes.
great professor, very helpful and willing to meet with students. prepares you for future dietetics work and internships
